text: Elihu Extols God’s Greatness
Then\f + \fr 36:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Elihu continued and said,
“Bear with me a little longer, and ⸤I will explain⸥,\f + \fr 36:2 \ft Literally “I will show you” \f*
for ⸤I still have something to say on God’s behalf⸥.\f + \fr 36:2 \ft Literally “yet on behalf of God words/sentences” \f*
I will bring my knowledge from far away,
and I will ascribe righteousness to my maker,
for truly my words\f + \fr 36:4 \ft Or “what I have to say” \f* \add are\add* not falsehood;
\add one who has\add* perfect knowledge \add is\add* with you.\f + \fr 36:4 \ft In other words, “Somebody who knows what he is talking about is addressing you” \f*
Look, God \add is\add* mighty but\f + \fr 36:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* does not despise \add anyone\add*;
\add he is\add* mighty \add and\add* ⸤good in understanding⸥.\f + \fr 36:5 \ft Literally “strength of heart” \f*
He does not keep \add the\add* wicked alive
but\f + \fr 36:6 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* grants justice \add to the\add* afflicted.
He does not withdraw his eyes from \add the\add* righteous,
but\f + \fr 36:7 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he sets them forever with kings on the throne, and they are exalted.
“And if \add they\add* are tied up with fetters,
\add if\add* they are caught in \add the\add* cords of misery,
then\f + \fr 36:9 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he declares their work to them,
and their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.
So\f + \fr 36:10 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he opens their ear to the discipline,
and he commands that they return from mischief.
If they listen and serve \add him\add*,
they complete their days in prosperity and their years in pleasantness.
But\f + \fr 36:12 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* if they do not listen, they perish by \add the\add* sword,
and they pass away without knowledge.
And \add the\add* godless of heart cherish anger;
they do not cry for help when he binds them.
⸤They die in their youth⸥,\f + \fr 36:14 \ft Literally “It dies in the youth of their self” \f*
and their life \add ends\add* among the male shrine prostitutes.
He delivers \add the\add* afflicted by his misery,
and he opens their ears by the adversity.
And what’s more, he allured you ⸤out of distress⸥\f + \fr 36:16 \ft Literally “from \fq the \ft mouth of distress” \f*
\add into\add* a broad place, \add where\add* in place of it \add was\add* no constraint;
and \add what\add* was set on your table is full of fatness.
But\f + \fr 36:17 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* you are obsessed with \add the\add* judgment of \add the\add* wicked;
judgment and justice take hold of you.
Yes,\f + \fr 36:18 \ft Or “Indeed” \f* \add it is\add* wrath, so that it will not incite you into mockery;
and do not let \add the\add* ransom’s greatness turn you aside.
Will your cry for help sustain \add you\add* without distress,
or\f + \fr 36:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* all \add the\add* efforts of \add your\add* strength?
You must not long for the night,
to cut off people ⸤in their place⸥.\f + \fr 36:20 \ft Literally “in place of them” \f*
Take care, you must not turn to mischief,
for because of this you have been tried by misery.
“Look, God is exalted in his power;
who \add is\add* a teacher like him?
Who has prescribed his way for him?
Or\f + \fr 36:23 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* who says, ‘You have done wrong’?
Remember that you should extol his work,
\add of\add* which people have sung.
All human beings have looked on it;
everyone watches from afar.
“Look, God \add is\add* exalted, and we do not know \add him\add*;
the number of his years is unsearchable.
Indeed, he draws up \add the\add* drops of water;
he distills \add the\add* rain into its mist,
which \add the\add* clouds pour down;
they shower abundantly on human beings.
“Moreover, ⸤can anyone understand⸥\f + \fr 36:29 \ft Literally “if he can understand” \f* \add the\add* spreading of clouds,
\add the\add* thundering of his dwelling place?
Look, he scatters his lightning around him,
and he covers the roots of the sea.
Indeed, he judges people by them;
he gives food ⸤in abundance⸥.\f + \fr 36:31 \ft Literally “as far as providing in abundance” \f*
He covers \add his\add* hands \add with\add* lightning,
and he commands it the place at \add which\add* to strike.
His thundering tells about him;
\add the\add* livestock also \add tell\add* ⸤concerning what rises⸥.\f + \fr 36:33 \ft Literally “about going up” \f*
